title: The Great Gatsby
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's masterpiece, a tragic love story set in the Roaring Twenties, exploring themes of wealth, illusion, and the American Dream.
George Orwell's chilling vision of a totalitarian future, where Big Brother watches your every move and thoughtcrime is the ultimate offense.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, a story of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South.

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's classic tale of love and social class in 19th-century England, featuring the witty Elizabeth Bennet and the proud Mr. Darcy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's iconic novel about Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager navigating the complexities of adolescence and phoniness.

title: Moby Dick
description: Herman Melville's epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for the white whale, Moby Dick, a classic of American literature.

title: War and Peace
description: Leo Tolstoy's sweeping saga of Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars, exploring themes of love, family, and the meaning of life.

title: Crime and Punishment
description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's gripping exploration of guilt, redemption, and the human psyche, centered on the tormented Raskolnikov.

title: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's beloved prequel to The Lord of the Rings, a charming tale of Bilbo Baggins's unexpected adventure.

title: Brave New World
description: Aldous Huxley's dystopian masterpiece, a cautionary tale of a future society controlled by technology and pleasure.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: Oscar Wilde's haunting story of a man whose portrait ages while he remains eternally youthful, exploring themes of vanity and morality.

title: Jane Eyre
description: Charlotte Brontë's classic romance, a story of a governess's journey to independence and love.

title: The Odyssey
description: Homer's epic poem, a tale of Odysseus's perilous journey home after the Trojan War.

title: Frankenstein
description: Mary Shelley's gothic masterpiece, a story of a scientist who creates a monstrous creature and the consequences that follow.

title: Dracula
description: Bram Stoker's iconic vampire novel, a chilling tale of Count Dracula and his reign of terror.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: Mark Twain's classic American novel, a story of a boy's journey down the Mississippi River and his friendship with a runaway slave.

title: Les Misérables
description: Victor Hugo's epic novel, a tale of redemption and social justice set against the backdrop of 19th-century France.

title: The Divine Comedy
description: Dante Alighieri's epic poem, a journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
description: Fyodor Dostoevsky's complex and profound novel, exploring themes of faith, doubt, and the nature of good and evil.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: Gabriel García Márquez's masterpiece, a sprawling and magical tale of the Buendía family and the town of Macondo.

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy, a quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: Animal Farm
description: George Orwell's allegorical novella, a satire of the Russian Revolution and the dangers of totalitarianism.

title: The Alchemist
description: Paulo Coelho's inspirational fable, a story of a shepherd boy's journey to discover his personal legend.

title: The Road
description: Cormac McCarthy's bleak and powerful novel, a post-apocalyptic journey of a father and son struggling to survive.

title: Life of Pi
description: Yann Martel's magical and thought-provoking novel, a story of a boy and a tiger adrift at sea.

title: The Book Thief
description: Markus Zusak's moving and beautifully written novel, narrated by Death, about a young girl in Nazi Germany who finds solace in books.

title: A Thousand Splendid Suns
description: Khaled Hosseini's poignant novel, a story of two women whose lives intertwine in war-torn Afghanistan.

title: The Kite Runner
description: Khaled Hosseini's powerful and moving novel, a story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set in Afghanistan.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
description: Yuval Noah Harari's sweeping and thought-provoking exploration of the history of humankind.

title: Educated
description: Tara Westover's inspiring memoir, a story of overcoming a restrictive upbringing and pursuing education.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: J.K. Rowling's magical start to the Harry Potter series, introducing the boy wizard and his adventures at Hogwarts.

title: The Da Vinci Code
description: Dan Brown's thrilling mystery, a race against time to unravel ancient secrets hidden in art and history.

title: The Hunger Games
description: Suzanne Collins's dystopian trilogy opener, a story of survival and rebellion in a televised death match.

title: Twilight
description: Stephenie Meyer's supernatural romance, a tale of forbidden love between a human and a vampire.

title: The Alchemist
description: Paulo Coelho's inspirational fable, a story of a shepherd boy's journey to discover his personal legend.

title: A Brief History of Time
description: Stephen Hawking's accessible exploration of the universe, from the Big Bang to black holes.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
description: Stieg Larsson's gripping mystery thriller, a story of a journalist and a hacker investigating a decades-old disappearance.

title: Gone Girl
description: Gillian Flynn's psychological thriller, a dark and twisty tale of a marriage gone wrong.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
description: John Green's poignant and heartfelt romance, a story of two teenagers with cancer who find love and meaning in life.

title: Angels & Demons
description: Dan Brown's suspenseful thriller, a race against time to prevent a deadly attack on the Vatican.
